projects.name: SDEngage
projects.tagline: Ticketing & event engagement platform with payments, QR access, and admin operations.
projects.intro: SDEngage is an end-to-end ticketing system designed to handle purchase flows, attendee validation, and on-ground operations reliably—while staying fast and smooth on mobile.
problem: Event teams needed a reliable system to sell tickets, validate attendance on-site, and manage changes without chaos.
Legacy/manual workflows caused delays in check-in, inconsistent attendee records, and weak visibility for organizers.
The platform needed to support multiple events, varying ticket rules, and real-time updates across devices.
constraints: High concurrency during ticket releases and event-day check-in spikes.
Payment flows must be resilient (callbacks/webhooks, retries, idempotency) and maintain strong data integrity.
Mobile UX must stay responsive even on weaker devices and unstable networks.
Operational needs: quick search, fast scanning, and near-real-time status sync for staff.
myRole: Led the end-to-end delivery across backend + mobile, coordinating tasks and aligning technical decisions with business needs.
Designed API contracts, data models, and validation rules to keep mobile and backend consistent.
Owned reliability-critical areas (payment status updates, event-day check-in performance, real-time notifications).

architecture.summary: Clients consume authenticated APIs. Payment callbacks update transactions and broadcast state changes to clients.

keyFeatures: Ticket purchase flow with promo codes, validation, and payment selection.
Transaction lifecycle: pending → success/fail with consistent state updates.
QR-based attendee validation and controlled check-in workflows.
Real-time notifications for transaction updates and operational events.
techChoicesWhy: Laravel for validation, transactional integrity, events/queues, and rapid backend iteration.
React Native for native-feeling UX with QR scanning and stable performance.
Real-time updates to keep critical status synchronized across devices.
Eager loading + paging strategies for large lists (orders/participants).
securityReliability: Authorization-first endpoints to reduce IDOR risks.
Idempotent payment completion logic to prevent double-fulfillment.
Defensive handling for nullability and edge cases.

projects.name: FastEV
projects.tagline: EV charging app with station discovery, QR start/stop flows, payments, and wallet top-ups.
projects.intro: FastEV focuses on a clean charging experience—from finding stations to starting a session, handling payments, and tracking history—while keeping state accurate in real time.
problem: Users needed a frictionless flow to discover chargers, start sessions quickly, and understand charging progress.
Operators needed reliable session state handling with correct connector availability and status updates.
Payment and wallet flows had to be consistent, auditable, and resilient against interruptions.
constraints: Connector status changes rapidly; UI must reflect updates without manual refresh.
Map/list views can be heavy; performance must remain premium.
Payments must handle callbacks, failures, retries, and partial states safely.
Sessions must stay accurate during flaky connectivity and app backgrounding.
myRole: Led system design across mobile, API integration, and real-time connector updates.
Defined state strategy so list + details remain consistent and live.
Drove performance work: chunk fetch, rendering optimization, stable UI states.

architecture.summary: Station/session APIs + real-time status updates. Wallet and transactions remain auditable through server-side records.

keyFeatures: Map + list station discovery with filters (connector types/operators/power).
QR-based connector selection and start session flow with confirmation steps.
Wallet top-ups and payments integrated into a clean checkout experience.
Charging session tracking: status, history, transaction journal, receipts-ready records.
Real-time connector status updates to prevent dead trips.
techChoicesWhy: React Native for consistent UX across devices.
Central state approach to prevent stale route params.
Chunked fetching to load nearby stations first without freezing UI.
Transaction journal for traceability across payment/session transitions.
securityReliability: Strict ownership checks for sessions and wallet operations.
Defensive handling for network drops and background/foreground transitions.
Consistent status enums and contract validation to avoid ghost states.
Receipt-ready records to support disputes and audit trails.

projects.name: PPKM
projects.tagline: Car inspection booking system with slot availability, holds, payments, and admin workflows.
projects.intro: PPKM makes appointment booking trustworthy and scalable—preventing overbooking, handling payments safely, and keeping staff workflows simple.
problem: Manual booking created overbooking risks, poor visibility, and operational overhead.
The system needed a fair reservation mechanism so multiple users couldn’t claim the same slot.
Admins needed clear booking status, auditability, and workflow alignment with operations.
constraints: Slot allocation must be consistent under concurrent booking attempts.
Payments must link to booking summaries and finalize only on confirmed success.
Wizard UX must enforce capacity rules without friction.
Automated cleanup needed for abandoned bookings.
myRole: Led data model and booking flow design (availability, holds, finalize on payment success).
Defined API endpoints and responsibilities to keep logic predictable.
Ensured booking states are auditable and operationally meaningful.

architecture.summary: Availability → Hold (expiring) → Payment → Finalize booking on success. Expired holds release automatically.

keyFeatures: Slot holds with expiry + idempotency keys.
Finalize booking on payment success; release on cancel/timeout.
Admin booking views with clean status tracking.
Scheduled expiry job to restore capacity automatically.
techChoicesWhy: Dedicated holds model to reduce concurrency issues and overbooking.
Scheduled expiry to keep capacity accurate without manual intervention.
Clear booking state fields to support audit trails.
Wizard flow to keep UX guided while preserving integrity.
securityReliability: Idempotent hold/book operations to prevent double booking.
Server-side validation for slot status and remaining capacity.
Atomic counter updates for pending/booked counts.
Snapshot fields to preserve booking-time state.
